sen.j: 慶雲の改革（けいうんのかいかく）は、飛鳥時代末期の慶雲3年（706年）以降、文武天皇統治下の朝廷において行われた律令体制改革をいう。
sen.e: Keiun no kaikaku is a political reform of Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on Ritsuryo Code) at the imperial court under the reign of Emperor Monmu, which was carried out since 706 at the end of the Asuka period.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の勝利後に史上初の「天皇」として即位し、思い切った国制改革を進めた天武天皇が没した後、皇后の持統天皇が即位。
sen.e: After the death of Emperor Tenmu, who was enthroned as the first 'emperor' in the Japanese history succeeding his victory at the Jinshin War and who implemented a drastic political reform, Empress Jito assumed the throne.

sen.e: To abide by the last wishes of Emperor Tenmu, she embarked on the construction of Fujiwara-kyo, which was the first large-scale capital city in Japan, and continued with streamlining Ritsuryo Code as well as the compilation project of a national history, including the establishment of Asuka Kiyomihara Code.

sen.e: The purpose of this extremely important envoy of Taiho era was: to restore the diplomatic relations with Tang which had been precarious since the Battle of Hakusukinoe; to proclaim to Tang the establishment of the full-scale capital and Ritsuryo system in Japan as a result of the reform since the time of Emperor Tenmu, as well as the foundation of the title of the emperor and the name of the country as 'Nihon' (Japan).

sen.e: In April 705, the fixed number of Dainagon (Major Counselor) was reduced by two people, the post of Chunagon (Middle Counselor), which had been abolished at that time of the establishment of Taiho Code, was revived as giseikan (Legislature) (the start of 'Ryoge no kan' (newly-established governmental posts which were not included in Ritsuryo Code)), and TAKAMUKO no Maro, AWATA no Mahito and ABE no Sukunamaro were newly appointed.

sen.j: 遺子の首皇子（後の聖武天皇）はまだ幼かったため、文武天皇の母である阿閇皇女が即位するという異例の措置がとられ、元明天皇となった。
sen.e: Because her bereaved child Prince Obito (later to become Emperor Shomu) was still too young, Princess Ahe, the mother of Emperor Monmu, ascended the throne in an unprecedented measure and became Empress Genmei.

sen.j: 元明朝においても国制改革はさらに加速し、和銅元年（708年）には、初の流通貨幣である和同開珎の発行、および長安の造形に倣った本格的都城となる平城京遷都の詔が発せられた（平城京は長安と同じく大極殿を北端に置く。実際の遷都は2年後の和銅3年）。
sen.e: During the reign of Empress Genmu, the national reform further accelerated, and in 708, the first currency Wado-kaichin was issued and an imperial decree to announce the transferring of the capital to Heijo-kyo, which was the full-scale capital modeled after Changan, was issued (As in Changan, Daigokuden in Heijo-kyo was located at the northernmost part.

During the reign of Empress Genmei, the national reform further accelerated, and in 708, the first currency Wado-kaichin was issued and an imperial decree to announce the transferring of the capital to Heijo-kyo, which was the full-scale capital modeled after Changan, was issued. (As in Changan, Daigokuden in Heijo-kyo was located at the northernmost part. The transfer of the capital was realized two years later in 710.)
sen.cmt: 誤訳のため、Genmu を Genmei に訂正しました。

(As in Changan, Daigokuden in Heijo-kyo was located at the northernmost part. The transfer of the capital was realized two years later in 710.)

sen.j: また同年、越後国に出羽郡（後の出羽国）が設置され、出羽柵を中心に蝦夷征討が開始した。
sen.e: In the same year, Ideha district in Dewa Province was designated, and the subjection of indigenous inhabitants in north-eastern Japan, using Dewa Castle as the home ground, was started.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処しました。
sen.e: In the same year, Ideha district (later Dewa Province) was establshed in Dewa Province, and the subjection of indigenous inhabitants in north-eastern Japan, using Dewa Castle as the home ground, was started.
sen.cmt: 誤訳、訳漏れのため、文全体を訂正しました。
sen.e: In the same year, Ideha district (later Dewa Province) was establshed in Dewa Province, and the subjection of indigenous inhabitants in north-eastern Japan, using Dewa Castle as the home ground, was started.

sen.j: 南でも隼人の入貢を促す（和銅6年（713年）には大隅国を設置）など、辺境の国土確定も積極的に行われた。
sen.e: In south, Hayato (an ancient tribe in Kyushu) was encouraged to pay tribute to the government (in 713, Osumi Province was designated) as a part of project to occupy the remote regions as a national territory.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処しました。
sen.e: As a part of project, the remote regions was also positively occupied as a national territory such as encouraging Hayato (an ancient tribe in Kyushu) to pay tribute to the government in south (in 713, Osumi Province was designated).

sen.j: この間も律令の不具合を修正する格式や律令本体の改訂作業は、藤原不比等らを中心に続けられており、後の養老律令制定につながることになる。
sen.e: During this period, the amendments and enforcement of Ritsuryo as well as the revision of Ritsuryo itself were carried out by a group led by FUJIWARA no Fuhito.

sen.cmt: 二分に分割する必要はないと思われますので、一文にまとめました。
